snippet: Pawnshops and gold dealers are thriving as cash-strapped Greeks give up valuables to make ends meet. But authorities say many of the shops are concealing a rapidly expanding illicit trade in gold.
abstract: Pawnshops and gold dealers in Athens are thriving as cash-strapped Greeks give up valuables to make ends meet, but authorities say many shops are concealing a rapidly expanding illicit trade in gold; say much of it is being smuggled out of the country, confounding efforts to curb rampant tax evasion.
lead_paragraph: Pawnshops and gold dealers are thriving as cash-strapped Greeks give up valuables to make ends meet. But authorities say many of the shops are concealing a rapidly expanding illicit trade in gold.
